foldername: Hourglass(invisible, time, mutual elements, NA, English)

images.description: A vintage hourglass with sand flowing through it.
A bustling city skyline at night with bright digital clocks showing various times.

explanation: The first image of the vintage hourglass symbolizes the passage of time in a traditional sense, emphasizing how time is measured and the inevitability of its flow. The second image represents modernity and the relentless pace of life in a city, where time is constantly being tracked and displayed digitally. Together, they highlight the concept of time as both a classical and contemporary construct, showing its enduring significance across different eras.
reasoning:
Measure(Time, VintageHourglass) and Flow(VintageHourglass, Sand)
Display(Time, DigitalClocks) and Count(BustlingCity, Time)
Thus, VintageHourglass → Time and BustlingCity → Time → Time

foldername: Leap Year(invisible, time, mutual elements, NA, English)

images.description: A group of people celebrating a birthday party with a large birthday cake and candles.

explanation: The first image depicts February 29th, which only occurs in leap years, making it a unique day that appears once every four years. The second image represents a birthday celebration; many people born on February 29th only get to celebrate their actual birthday during leap years. Therefore, both images are connected through the concept of 'Leap Year,' highlighting the rarity and significance of February 29th.
reasoning:
Contains(February29, LeapYear)
Celebrates(BirthdayParty, LeapYear) and BornOn(February29, People)
Thus, February29 → LeapYear and BirthdayParty → LeapYear

Thus, Rings → Time and Hourglass → Time → Aging.
